name: stats
summary: Analyze OSM file and display comprehensive statistics
description:
The stats command provides detailed analysis of an OSM file including:
- Element counts (nodes, ways, relations)
- Geographic bounds and center point
- Tag usage statistics
- Breakdown of highway, amenity, and building types
- Processing performance metrics

This is useful for understanding the contents of an OSM file before processing, or for quality assurance checks.

options.-s, --summary: Output a single-line summary instead of full report
options.--json: Output statistics as JSON for programmatic use
options.--suggest-bbox: Suggest bounding boxes for splitting large files

output:
Default output includes:
- File size and processing rate
- Node/Way/Relation counts
- Geographic bounds (min/max lat/lon)
- Top 10 most used tag keys
- Highway type breakdown
- Amenity type breakdown
- Building type breakdown

JSON output includes all data in machine-readable format.
